name: Boolean()
return_value:
When Boolean() is called as a constructor (with new), it creates a Boolean object, which is not a primitive.
When Boolean() is called as a function (without new), it coerces the parameter to a boolean primitive.

Warning: You should rarely find yourself using Boolean as a constructor.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The initial value of the Boolean object.

name: Boolean.prototype.constructor
description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For Boolean instances, the initial value is the Boolean constructor.

name: Boolean.prototype.toString()
description: Returns a string of either true or false depending upon the value of the object. Overrides the Object.prototype.toString() method.
return_value: A string representing the specified boolean value.

name: Boolean.prototype.valueOf()
description: Returns the primitive value of the Boolean object. Overrides the Object.prototype.valueOf() method.
return_value: The primitive value of the given Boolean object.
